author: Special Correspondent
text:
Members of Social Democratic Party of India staged a demonstration at Karunkalpalayam on Sunday urging the Central Government to restrain GAIL (Gas Authority of India Limited) from laying natural gas pipelines across agricultural fields in Western region.

They raised slogans assailing the Centre and demanded withdrawal of The Petroleum and Minerals Pipelines Act. Former Erode MP A. Ganeshamoorthy and other speakers fixed the responsibility of safeguarding farmers’ welfare on the Central Government by way of aligning the pipeline route along National Highways.
title: GAIL project: protest staged
